page.title: 08Dairy farming at Morwick
page.content: Dairy farming is the main feature of Morwick Farm.There are 92 pedigree Ayrshire cows in milk,producing almost 2,160 gallons of milk daily.This is collected by tanker and sold locally to Eshott Farms who have their own bottling plant.The milking parlour is based on a "herring-bone" design which enables one dairyman to supervise the milking operation.During milking the cows are fed cattle cake.A computer controls the amount of food each cow receives.In winter the cows are kept in a large shed and fed silage and barley mixed with molasses and minerals. When a cow goes "dry" she is put into calf again. The young calf is taken away from it's mother and reared on dried milk.
